official-title.#text:
To provide that certain requirements of the Patient
		  Protection and Affordable Care Act do not apply if the American Health Benefit
		  Exchanges are not operating on October 1, 2013.

sponsor.#tail: introduced the following bill; which was referred to the

committee-name.#tail: , and in addition to the Committee on

, for a
			 period to be subsequently determined by the Speaker, in each case for
			 consideration of such provisions as fall within the jurisdiction of the
			 committee concerned

text.#text: This Act may be cited as the

header.#text:
Nonapplication of
			 the Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
is amended by adding at the end the
			 following:

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text:
Section 1311 of the Patient Protection and
			 Affordable Care Act
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act/s:1311

text.#text:
If one or more Exchanges fails to accept applications
				for enrollment in qualified health plans beginning on October 1, 2013, the
				requirements of this section shall cease to apply, and any other provisions of
				this Act (or an amendment made by this Act) relating to Exchanges shall not be
				applicable.

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
is
			 amended by adding at the end the following:

external-xref.#tail: of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
determines that one or more Exchanges fails to accept
				applications for enrollment in qualified health plans on such
				date.

text.#text:
The
				provisions of this section shall terminate on October 1, 2013, if the

{http://purl.org/dc/elements/1.1/}title.#text: 113 HR 2938 IH: Exchange Sunset Act of 2013
